perturbation.original_text: Network shall submit to Affiliate, within forty-five (45) days of the end of each calendar quarter during the Term, a statement reporting for such calendar quarter the following information on a Station-by-Station basis: (i) Network's Advertising Revenue, (ii) the Affiliate Advertising Share, (iii) Network's Transactional Revenue, (iv) the average number of households receiving the Service through each MVPD in each DMA served by a Station, as calculated herein, and (v) the Affiliate Transactional Share. If this Agreement terminates on any date other than at the end of a calendar quarter, Network shall supply such statement as of the date of termination, within forty-five (45) days thereafter, and this obligation shall survive the termination of this Agreement until Affiliate receives such statement.
perturbation.changed_text: Network shall submit to Affiliate, within sixty (60) days of the end of each calendar quarter during the Term, a statement reporting for such calendar quarter the following information on a Station-by-Station basis: (i) Network's Advertising Revenue, (ii) the Affiliate Advertising Share, (iii) Network's Transactional Revenue, (iv) the average number of households receiving the Service through each MVPD in each DMA served by a Station, as calculated herein, and (v) the Affiliate Transactional Share. If this Agreement terminates on any date other than at the end of a calendar quarter, Network shall supply such statement as of the date of termination, within thirty (30) days thereafter, and this obligation shall survive the termination of this Agreement until Affiliate receives such statement.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by stating two different deadlines for when the Network must submit a report to the Affiliate after the end of each calendar quarter: sixty (60) days vs the original forty-five (45) days. Furthermore, there is a second contradiction regarding the timeline of the report if the agreement terminates, stating thirty (30) days vs the original forty-five (45) days, creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: The Affiliate Advertising Share, if any, shall be payable quarterly and shall be due no later than forty-five (45) days following the end of each calendar quarter for which a payment is due. If this Agreement is terminated during a calendar quarter, the amount payable shall be determined as of the termination date.
perturbation.changed_text: The Affiliate Advertising Share, if any, shall be payable quarterly and shall be due no later than thirty (30) days following the end of each calendar quarter for which a payment is due. If this Agreement is terminated during a calendar quarter, the amount payable shall be determined ten (10) days from the termination date.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation creates a contradiction by changing the payment deadline for the Affiliate Advertising Share from forty-five (45) days to thirty (30) days following the end of each calendar quarter. If the agreement is terminated the amount payable is due ten (10) days from the termination date, creating an inconsistency with the original text.

perturbation.original_text: The Affiliate Transactional Share, if any, shall be payable quarterly and shall be due no later than forty-five (45) days following the end of each calendar quarter for which a payment is due. If this Agreement is terminated during a calendar quarter, the amount payable shall be determined as of the termination date.
perturbation.changed_text: The Affiliate Transactional Share, if any, shall be payable quarterly and shall be due no later than sixty (60) days following the end of each calendar quarter for which a payment is due. If this Agreement is terminated during a calendar quarter, the amount payable shall be determined thirty (30) days from the termination date.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation introduces a contradiction regarding the payment timeline for the Affiliate Transactional Share. The original text states it's due no later than forty-five (45) days after the quarter, while the modified text extends it to sixty (60) days, creating uncertainty. Furthermore, the original text mentions that when this agreement is terminated during a calendar quarter the amount payable shall be determined as of the termination date, but the modified text claims it is thirty (30) days from the termination date.
